intro: Phyllanthus graveolens subsp. benthamianus, commonly known as the African spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It is a shrub characterized by its small, yellowish-green flowers and hairy leaves. The plant belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is often found in disturbed soils and open habitats. It has a compact growth habit and is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant. Its botanical features include glandular hairs on the foliage and a distinctive fruit structure.
